list_definition.mean_english: sự tóe lửa, sự lấp lánh
list_definition.definition: an effect like that made by little sparks

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There was a sudden sparkle as her diamond ring caught the light.

list_definition.definition: to glitter, as if throwing off tiny sparks

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The snow sparkled in the sunlight.

list_definition.mean_english: tỏ ra sắc sảo, linh lợi

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She really sparkled at that party.

list_ex_of_english: The best time of day to see the falls is in full sunlight when the water sparkles the most.
His eyes were little protruding eyes, and they sparkled like stars.
Zintar was cast in both a silver sparkled plastic and also in plain light gray plastic.
She sparkles, sizzles and infuses energy into the film.
The wings are mouse-grey, sparkled with black atoms and crossed by 4 zig-zag white stripes.
In their works, sparkling, romantic, affectionate, lyric, and virtuoso passages flow and coexist effortlessly.
The tomb, a square chamber, is made of local quartzite rubble with a surface plaster finish that sparkled in white colour when completed.
Of the water he noted, it is clearly natural, and not artificial, and sparkles as clear as crystal.
